meanings.definition: To burst or explode with excitement or emotion.
meanings.sent1: The children were plotzing with joy when they saw the colorful balloons.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help plotzing with happiness when she received the unexpected gift.
meanings.sent3: The puppy started plotzing around the room after seeing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it was plotzing with love when she looked into his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks in the sky made her feel like her heart was plotzing with excitement.

meanings.definition: To collapse or faint from shock or surprise.
meanings.sent1: The news was so shocking that she plotzed on the spot.
meanings.sent2: He plotzed when he saw the ghostly figure in the dark hallway.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plotzing of the magician left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: Her world seemed to plotz around her when she heard the unbelievable truth.
meanings.sent5: The surprise party made her plotz with shock as she entered the room.
